intro: Funastrum pannosum, commonly known as the hairy funastrum, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Funastrum pannosum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil types.
